intro: Dracaena mandaianum, commonly known as the Madagascar dragon tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that bloom in clusters at the top of the stem. Dracaena mandaianum is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
